availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard Fletcher Vinson (Lawrence Circuit and County Court Clerk)

body.p: Louisa, Kentucky, farmer, and Lawrence County, Kentucky, circuit and county clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Georgia Ann Randall Vinson on August 31, 1859. Father of Victoria Vinson and Jennie Vinson. Farmer in Louisa in 1860. Circuit clerk and county clerk in Lawrence County from 1864 to 1870.

(Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1865), 9-12.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865,” in 1865/66 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1866), 9-12.

(Frankfort, Ky.: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 347-350. “Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1870,” in 1866 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 10. (Frankfort, Ky.: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1870), 102. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 2.
